# monospaced(_:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a font adding or removing fixed-width design from the same family as the base font.

## Declaration

```swift
func monospaced(_ isActive: Bool) -> Font
```

## Return Value

A font with the fixed-width design added or removed, from the same family as the base font, if one is available, and a default font otherwise.

## Discussion

If there’s no suitable font face in the same family, SwiftUI returns a default font.

The following example adds the `monospaced()` modifier to the default system font, then applies this font to a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Text] view:

```swift
struct ContentView: View {
    let myFont = Font
        .system(size: 24)
        .monospaced(true)

    var body: some View {
        Text("Hello, world!")
            .font(myFont)
            .padding()
            .navigationTitle("Monospaced")
    }
}
```



SwiftUI may provide different fixed-width replacements for standard user interface fonts (such as [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Font/title], or a system font created with [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Font/system(_:design:)]) than for those same fonts when created by name with [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Font/custom(_:size:)].

The [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/font(_:)] modifier applies the font to all text within the view. To mix fixed-width text with other styles in the same `Text` view, use the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Text/init(_:)-1a4oh] initializer to use an appropriately-styled [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/AttributedString] for the text view’s content. You can use the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/AttributedString/init(markdown:options:baseURL:)-52n3u] initializer to provide a Markdown-formatted string containing the backtick-syntax (`…`) to apply code voice to specific ranges of the attributed string.
